messages.title: A PERSONAL MESSAGE FROM DAVID CAMERON
messages.content: Thirteen years ago Labour were elected promising change. But today, with the economy in a mess and a growing gap between rich and poor, a lot of people feel let down. Perhaps you're one of them. I'm writing to you today to tell you that you donâ€™t need to give up hope for a fairer, stronger country. The Conservative Party has the energy and ideas to change Britain.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to the NHS in Scotland, improving it, severe cuts without job losses.
Tackle the debt and create jobs so businesses can flourish.
Freeze in Council Tax for the next two years.
Raise the basic state pension in line with earnings and prices.
Increase in the number of health visitors by 4,200.
Keep tax credits and free TV licenses for older people and scrapping hospital parking charges in Scotland.

issues.brexitEurope: Keep tax credits and free TV licenses for older people and scrapping hospital parking charges in Scotland.
issues.economy: Tackle the debt and create jobs so businesses can flourish.
issues.governance: Freeze in Council Tax for the next two years.
issues.health: Increase in the number of health visitors by 4,200.
issues.socialWelfare: Raise the basic state pension in line with earnings and prices.

leaflet.personalStatement: I hope you take this chance to vote for change.

contactInformation.address: Scottish Conservative Central Office, 67 Northumberland Street, Edinburgh, EH3 6JG

images.caption: David Cameron interacting with various people and speaking at events.
